intro: Lepismium tucumanense, commonly known as the Tucumán nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom at night, attracting specific pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
